abilities.description: Emits beams of Noroma photons that slow down any object or person they hit for 30 seconds.

Using the Mirror Ball device, Foxy reflects his Noro Noro Beam through spinning mirrors to create multiple beams hitting in all directions simultaneously. Named after the thousand-armed Kannon Buddhist deity.

weaknesses.weakness: Mirrors can reflect the Noroma photons, which while useful tactically, could potentially be used against the user.
Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses - inability to swim, weakness to Seastone and Haki.

keyMoments.title: Mirror Ball Technique Introduced
keyMoments.description: Foxy reveals a mechanical Mirror Ball device that reflects his Noro Noro Beam through spinning mirrors for enhanced tactical use.
keyMoments.significance: Shows innovation in devil fruit application through technology.

keyMoments.title: Senju Kannon Noro Noro Beam Debut
keyMoments.description: Foxy uses the Mirror Ball to create an area-of-effect attack that slows multiple opponents simultaneously.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates an evolution of the fruit's combat applications.

trivia.fact: The Noro Noro no Mi produces Noroma photons which are beams of light that can be reflected by mirrors, as demonstrated with the Mirror Ball technique.
The Senju Kannon Noro Noro Beam is named after Sahasrabhuja-arya-avalokitesvara (Thousand-Armed Kannon), a Buddhist deity depicted with multiple arms, referencing the multiple reflected beams.

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Bazooka Defeats Foxy
keyMoments.description: Luffy uses his classic Gomu Gomu no Bazooka technique to defeat Foxy and his crew despite their new Mirror Ball technology.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that raw power and experience can overcome tactical innovation.

keyMoments.title: Robin Saves Falling Crew Members
keyMoments.description: Robin uses her Hana Hana no Mi powers to catch falling Straw Hat crew members after Foxy's trap is triggered.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin's tactical use of her powers for rescue operations.
